item.title: Pregnant women urged to get jab as majority unvaccinated
item.description: Estimates suggest that hundreds of thousands of pregnant women in England have not yet had the vaccine.

item.title: Nightclubs start asking for NHS Covid pass in England
item.description: It comes as the Lib Dems demand MPs debate their use in England amid concerns over discrimination.

item.title: Migrant women and babies held in shocking conditions, MPs find
item.description: A group of MPs describes scenes at a Dover asylum unit as "wholly inappropriate" and a Covid risk.

item.title: Walking and biking prioritised in new Highway Code
item.description: Greater priority for pedestrians at crossings and for cyclists at junctions are among the changes.

item.title: Russian module mishap destabilises International Space Station
item.description: The ISS was pushed out of position after engines on a new Russian module unexpectedly fired up.

item.title: Covid-19: Biden tells states to offer $100 vaccine incentive as cases rise
item.description: The US president also announced that all federal workers must be vaccinated or subjected to testing.

item.title: Storm Evert: South West braced for 75mph winds and heavy rain
item.description: Heavy rain and strong winds are expected to hit the region.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Self-isolation rules to ease for double jabbed
item.description: Fully vaccinated contacts of positive Covid cases will not have to isolate from 7 August.

item.title: Dairy giant Arla says driver crisis hitting milk supply
item.description: Supermarket supplier Arla Foods says a lorry driver shortage has forced it to cut deliveries by up to 25%.

item.title: Scarlett Johansson sues Disney over streaming of Black Widow
item.description: The star says box office takings for Black Widow were hit when it was streamed at the same time.

item.title: Covid in Sydney: Military deployed to help enforce lockdown
item.description: Authorities say the deployment is needed, but critics argue it will "pick on" marginalised groups.

item.title: US sailor charged over massive USS Bonhomme warship blaze in 2020
item.description: More than 60 people were injured, and the $1bn USS Bonhomme Richard had to be scrapped.

item.title: The Papers: 'No jab, no job' threat and 'red alert' for travel
item.description: The papers cover concerns about compulsory vaccination at work and possible changes to travel rules.

item.title: Olympics: The hidden sight of Tokyo's homeless
item.description: For many among Tokyo's homeless community the Olympics are far from a cause for celebration.

item.title: Rapper ENNY talks sexual consent in latest track
item.description: The rising south London rapper talks about art imitating life in her new single.

item.title: Cheerleader Sarah Frei's fight back after having both legs amputated
item.description: A drunk driver changed teenager Sarah Frei’s life, but a year on, she’s determined to stay positive.

item.title: Disease killing 'Europe's oldest' elm tree
item.description: Believed to almost 800 years old, the Beauly elm has been laser scanned as part of work to document it.

item.title: Mikey Poulli: The young blind footballer backed by star players
item.description: Mikey Poulli, who lost his sight due to a rare degenerative condition, dreams of playing for England.

item.title: In pictures: International Tiger Day 2021
item.description: The annual event aims to raise awareness around the endangered big cats.

item.title: ‘I'm black, my partner's white - stop asking me if this is my baby’
item.description: When Ena Miller had a baby, she was unprepared for the constant comments about her daughter's skin tone.

item.title: China warns UK as carrier strike group approaches
item.description: A fleet of British ships is currently sailing through the South China Sea en route to Japan.

item.title: The Strokes Is This It at 20: Nudes, booze and 9/11
item.description: How the New York City band's 2001 debut album heralded "a new spirit in guitar music".

item.title: 'I was asked how often I use the toilet'
item.description: Disabled jobseekers have to overcome too many barriers, MPs say.

item.title: Dressage: How to make a horse dance
item.description: For some, it's an oddity to watch only at the Olympics... for others, it's a lifetime of training.

item.title: The seaweed farmers with high hopes for their harvest
item.description: Kelp grown off the coast of the Isle of Skye could be used in food, packaging and cosmetic products.

item.title: The fungus and bacteria tackling plastic waste
item.description: Bacteria, fungus and enzymes can all digest plastic, but can they work at a useful commercial scale?

item.title: Covid and a coup: The double crisis pushing Myanmar to the brink
item.description: A surge in virus cases has dealt a fresh blow to a country already dealing with military coup.

item.title: Could a Covid 'pingdemic' ruin the start of the English football season?
item.description: BBC Sport looks at how the new English football season will cope with Covid-19 testing and contact tracing now that restrictions have been lifted.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Duncan Scott wins silver medal in 200m individual medley final
item.description: Duncan Scott wins his third medal of the Tokyo Olympics and GB's sixth in the pool with silver in the men's 200m individual medley.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Team GB's men's eight crew win bronze medal in 'incredible' final
item.description: Team GB's men's eight crew win bronze in the final race of the Tokyo 2020 regatta, being narrowly pipped to silver by Germany as New Zealand take gold.

item.title: Erasmus records hour-long video demanding 'equal chance' from Lions Test officials
item.description: South Africa boss Rassie Erasmus records an hour-long video monologue railing against the refereeing in his side's first-Test defeat by the British and Irish Lions.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Luke Greenbank wins bronze for GB in 200m backstroke final
item.description: Team GB swimmer Luke Greenbank wins a bronze medal in the 200m backstroke final at the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: The Hundred - London Spirit v Trent Rockets: Watch the best of Thursday's action
item.description: Watch the best moments of Thursday's action in the women's and men's Hundred as London Spirit took on Trent Rockets at Lord's.

item.title: Aberdeen survive Hacken scare to progress in Europa Conference League - highlights & report
item.description: Aberdeen were "victims of our own success", says manager Stephen Glass, after his side progressed in the Europa Conference League despite a second-leg defeat by BK Hacken.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Bethany Shriever & Kye Whyte win historic medals in BMX racing
item.description: Britain's Bethany Shriever wins gold in the women's BMX racing final, moments after Kye Whyte claims the nation's first Olympic medal in the men's.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Duncan Scott wins third medal with silver in 200m medley
item.description: Duncan Scott wins his third medal of the Tokyo Olympics and Great Britain's sixth in the pool with silver in the men's 200m individual medley.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB men's eight take bronze, Vicky Thornley fourth
item.description: Great Britain fail to win an Olympic rowing gold for the first Games since 1984 as the men's eight crew claim bronze.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB's rower Vicky Thornley misses out on bronze medal in single sculls
item.description: Team GB's Vicky Thornley narrowly misses out on a bronze medal as she finishes fourth in the single sculls at the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Dina Asher Smith begins women's 100m bid - all you need to know about Tokyo Games flagship event
item.description: With Dina Asher-Smith starting her bid to win the women's 100m gold on Friday, the flagship event is expected to be a "fierce battle" from start to finish.

item.title: American Lee takes gold as Biles watches on
item.description: American Sunisa Lee takes gymnastics all-around gold at the Olympics as defending champion Simone Biles watches from the stands after withdrawing to prioritise her mental health.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Helen Glover rules out another Games bid
item.description: Britain's Helen Glover rules out another Olympics rowing bid after the mother of three's hopes of a fairytale finish at Tokyo 2020 are dashed.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics medals table
item.description: Medals table for the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Day-by-day guide to the key events, big stars and British medal hopes
item.description: Want to know what's happening when in Tokyo? Check out our comprehensive guide to all the action in Japan.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Take a tour of the incredible venues
item.description: They range from an arena built by a father and son, to a legendary home of Japanese martial arts.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid symptoms: Is it a cold or coronavirus?
item.description: With similar symptoms, deciding whether or not you need to get tested for coronavirus can be tricky.

item.title: The EU vaccine 'passport' and what it means for travel
item.description: An EU vaccine "passport" is being introduced, enabling holders to prove they have been jabbed.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: All over-18s can now get the Covid jab, but the government has criticised take-up among young people.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does the NHS test-and-trace system and app work?
item.description: A record number of alerts are being sent by the NHS Covid app.

item.title: Coronavirus: Four numbers that reveal the real trends
item.description: Does a week of falling case numbers mean we're close to the end?

item.title: Covid: Who has to self-isolate, which workers are exempt and what if I'm fully vaccinated?
item.description: A small number of named employees in key sectors will be exempt from some rules

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid passports: How do they work around the world?
item.description: How are countries enforcing vaccine passports and what can people use them for?

item.title: What are the holiday rules for travel to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: People vaccinated in Europe or the US will no longer need to isolate when arriving from amber countries.

item.title: Covid rules: What has changed?
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules have taken effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: What are the travel rules for Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots?
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: 'Covid passports': How can the NHS Covid Pass prove I've had both jabs?
item.description: Clubbers and people attending mass events in England will have to prove they've had both Covid jabs.

item.title: Lockdown muscle loss: Five ways to get back in shape
item.description: Lockdown inactivity may have left people with weaker muscles - there are simple solutions.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: New research links as many as 200 different symptoms to the condition.

item.title: Covid vaccines: How fast is progress around the world?
item.description: Charts and maps tracking the progress of Covid vaccination programmes.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The progress made in vaccinating the country's adult population, as more than 46 million people have received at least one dose.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Care homes worst hit by Covid – search the data
item.description: Figures from Care Quality Commission lay out the pandemic's 'devastating impact' on care homes in England.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Tokyo Olympic Games: When are they and how will Covid affect them?
item.description: The Tokyo Summer Olympics have begun, despite a surge in Covid cases in Japan.

item.title: Covid: Why is social distancing coming to an end?
item.description: Social distancing rules are changing across the UK.

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: Vaccine experts recommend that a limited group of children should be offered Covid jabs ahead of winter.

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to avoid catching the virus indoors
item.description: As social distancing restrictions end in England and ease in Scotland, good ventilation remains vital.

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Medical teams around the world are learning which medicines work best against Covid.
